1.1.behavioral_axis: Builds creative identity from a strong inner base before showing it.
1.1.shadow_axis: Fear of not being special, copying others to feel valid.

1.2.behavioral_axis: Radiates unique creative energy without trying, inspires by just existing.
1.2.shadow_axis: Withdraws or sulks if pushed to perform on demand.

1.3.behavioral_axis: Builds authentic voice by testing, failing, iterating in public.
1.3.shadow_axis: Self-sabotage loops, burning identity down after every mistake.

1.4.behavioral_axis: Shares personal aesthetic so others can align around it.
1.4.shadow_axis: Image-padding or clout-seeking just to stay relevant.

1.5.behavioral_axis: Becomes the person others expect to ‘set the tone’ for everyone.
1.5.shadow_axis: Burden of expectations, accused of faking it or selling out.

1.6.behavioral_axis: Embodies ‘this is who I am’ so cleanly it becomes a model.
1.6.shadow_axis: Detached superiority, judging others as less evolved creatively.

2.1.behavioral_axis: Needs solid internal clarity about direction before moving.
2.1.shadow_axis: Paralyzed waiting for the perfect map from outside.

2.2.behavioral_axis: Just ‘knows’ where resources and people belong.
2.2.shadow_axis: Resents being asked to lead, hides gifts out of annoyance.

2.3.behavioral_axis: Learns right path by repeatedly taking wrong turns and adapting.
2.3.shadow_axis: Feels unreliable, judged as aimless or reckless.

2.4.behavioral_axis: Provides direction for others by linking the right people and places.
2.4.shadow_axis: Political positioning, steering people for personal leverage.

2.5.behavioral_axis: Others expect you to fix direction for the group fast.
2.5.shadow_axis: Blamed when the route doesn’t save everyone instantly.

2.6.behavioral_axis: Embodies long-term direction for a collective, not just short-term moves.

3.1.behavioral_axis: Wants a workable base before allowing change to spread.
3.1.shadow_axis: Anxiety around disorder, over-controlling the new.

3.2.behavioral_axis: Can produce elegant fixes for early-stage chaos without help.
3.2.shadow_axis: Refuses collaboration, rejects input even when drowning.

3.3.behavioral_axis: Mutates systems by stress-testing them in real conditions.
3.3.shadow_axis: Permanent instability, drama loops, constant crisis mode.

3.4.behavioral_axis: Translates unstable beginnings into something others can use.
3.4.shadow_axis: Spins instability to gain influence or sympathy.

3.5.behavioral_axis: Gets projected on as ‘the one who can make this broken system work for everyone.’
3.5.shadow_axis: Scapegoated when the mess is actually unfixable.

3.6.behavioral_axis: Understands how chaotic beginnings mature into stable forms over time.
3.6.shadow_axis: Detached cynicism: ‘everything starts broken so why care.’

4.1.behavioral_axis: Builds answers only after creating a solid internal reasoning base.
4.1.shadow_axis: Over-defensive, rejects ideas that feel uncertain.

4.2.behavioral_axis: Translates doubt into a clean logical answer without forcing it.
4.2.shadow_axis: Irritated when asked to justify what ‘should be obvious.’

4.3.behavioral_axis: Finds truth by poking holes in bad logic and adapting.
4.3.shadow_axis: Cynical nitpicker, invalidates everything to feel smart.

4.4.behavioral_axis: Spreads a workable mental model through the community.
4.4.shadow_axis: Sells certainty they don’t actually have just to maintain influence.

4.5.behavioral_axis: Becomes the ‘go-to’ mind people rely on to resolve doubt fast.
4.5.shadow_axis: Blamed as manipulative if the fix is uncomfortable.

4.6.behavioral_axis: Embodies ‘here’s why this will still make sense later.’
4.6.shadow_axis: Intellectual distancing, judging others as irrational children.

5.1.behavioral_axis: Protects their natural timing and expects life to respect it.
5.1.shadow_axis: Feels unsafe when rhythm breaks, locks down control.

5.2.behavioral_axis: Moves in a personally correct rhythm that often syncs nature-level.
5.2.shadow_axis: Withdraws or shuts down if pressured to speed up.

5.3.behavioral_axis: Finds sustainable rhythm by repeatedly breaking and rebuilding habits.
5.3.shadow_axis: Chaos lifestyle, claims ‘this is just how I am.’

5.4.behavioral_axis: Stabilizes the group's daily flow by modeling cadence.
5.4.shadow_axis: Resentment when others lean on them as the metronome.

5.5.behavioral_axis: Others expect them to ‘solve’ timing/consistency problems.
5.5.shadow_axis: Blamed when the whole team can’t self-regulate.

5.6.behavioral_axis: Holds an elder-level sense of what healthy pace looks like for a life.
5.6.shadow_axis: Detached judgment of people who can’t maintain discipline.

6.1.behavioral_axis: Creates a safe container before letting intimacy in.
6.1.shadow_axis: Hyper-guarded, assumes threat in every approach.

6.2.behavioral_axis: Can generate instant emotional bond or repulsion without overthinking.
6.2.shadow_axis: Avoids conflict talks, ghosts instead of clarifying.

6.3.behavioral_axis: Figures out what intimacy really means by surviving emotional clashes.
6.3.shadow_axis: Drama addiction, escalating fights to feel alive.

6.4.behavioral_axis: Mediates emotional tension so the network can hold together.
6.4.shadow_axis: Manipulates alliances, weaponizes loyalty and access.

keywords: people expect you to fix feelings
6.5.behavioral_axis: Gets cast as the one who can resolve heavy emotional situations for everyone.
6.5.shadow_axis: Called toxic or controlling if peace requires boundaries.

6.6.behavioral_axis: Embodies ‘this is healthy closeness’ and won’t settle below it.

7.1.behavioral_axis: Wants to understand ‘what position am I actually holding’ before leading.
7.1.shadow_axis: Won’t move unless authority is guaranteed.

7.2.behavioral_axis: Radiates correct direction for others without loud ego.

7.3.behavioral_axis: Refines direction by testing plans in messy, real conditions.
7.3.shadow_axis: Instability in command, seen as unreliable.

7.4.behavioral_axis: Becomes the spokesperson who aligns the direction of the tribe.
7.4.shadow_axis: Political maneuvering, steering narrative to lock in influence.

7.5.behavioral_axis: Others assume you can ‘take charge and fix it for everyone.’
7.5.shadow_axis: Blamed as tyrant if they don't like your decisions.

7.6.behavioral_axis: Holds the mature vision of where the group needs to go long-term.
7.6.shadow_axis: Detached elitism, ‘I know best, you’re all naive.’

8.1.behavioral_axis: Won’t promote their voice until they trust its integrity.
8.1.shadow_axis: Hides brilliance out of fear of being judged.

8.2.behavioral_axis: Can step forward and represent ‘the vibe’ for everyone without trying.
8.2.shadow_axis: Withdraws or gets passive-aggressive if pushed to perform.

8.3.behavioral_axis: Offers value by saying ‘here’s what I actually tested in the field.’
8.3.shadow_axis: Reputation volatility, others see you as inconsistent.

8.4.behavioral_axis: Uses personal style/voice to give the network a shared banner.
8.4.shadow_axis: Clout politics, leveraging group loyalty for status.

8.5.behavioral_axis: Becomes the face that’s expected to carry the entire message outward.
8.5.shadow_axis: Accused of being fake, manipulative, self-promoting.

8.6.behavioral_axis: Represents ‘this is who we are’ at a mature, archetypal level.
8.6.shadow_axis: Detached superiority, gatekeeping who’s ‘real enough’ to belong.
